text: <@U02GGCCLTKM> - I won't be reducing any time allocated to the syndicates as I have very modest "contractual" weekly hours to work for them which leaves plenty of time for my own strategies. For one of the syndicates, we went through a quite painful process several years ago now to get to the point where we could agree on terms to allow us to work on outside projects. For the other, we've struggled for a couple of years to make any kind of meaningful profit and the other members are my brother and best friend so they are understanding of my desire to branch out on my own, and I'm much more willing to dedicate more hours to working than they are. If more details would be helpful for your situation feel free to DM me

text:
<@U07M5JNP0HZ> Other users can confirm this, regarding a more detailed odds-to-odds check, in relation to the *volume traded*, only in odds `2.0` is the value exactly half for Back and half for Lay. In other odds, this is not the case, because the liability is different for Back and Lay. In this case, to separate the volume it would be like this:

```odds_volume_back = odds_volume / odds
odds_volume_lay = odds_volume - volume_back```
Example, odds `1.50` and `1000` traded:

```odds_volume_back = 1000 / 1.50 → 666,66...
odds_volume_lay = 1000 - 666,66 → 333,33...```
But in the case of the total volume traded on the market, it is fifty-fifty.

But please wait for confirmation from other users with more knowledge confirm what I'm saying.

text:
Guys, another topic:

Could someone who has an account with <http://betfair.com|betfair.com> please confirm the volume traded in `currency_code="GBP"` specifically for this runner:

"event_id": "33907483"
"market_id": "1.237786775"
"selection_id": 23278850

→ Betfair in Brazil now has a specific website for our country (.<http://bet.br|bet.br>) and I need to confirm if the volume traded that I am receiving through the API is general or if it has been limited to only the volume traded in Brazil. Thank you very much for your help!

text: It's been years since I looked, but I think BDQ used to be matched liabilities. £5 either side at 1.5 on Betfair = £10, on DBQ it was £15. Same deal with 3.0 (but other way around on backer/layer amounts). Effect gets larger as you get further away from 2.0.

text: <@U4H19D1D2> I had this doubt regarding the volume traded at each odds a while ago and the answer I got was that to separate the Back and Lay volume you needed to use the Liability required for each to match the stake. So is this not correct?

elements.text: I had this doubt regarding the volume traded at each odds a while ago and the answer I got was that to separate the Back and Lay volume you needed to use the Liability required for each to match the stake. So is this not correct?

text:
Not sure I really understand what you are saying but the docs state this

> • *Traded volume (tv)* is calculated as backers stake x 2. For example, 4.1,"tv":37.64 indicates that a total backers stake of £18.82 has been matched at a price of 4.1/
ie. the layers liability isn't applicable however it is on betdaq where it is calculated differently

elements.text: Not sure I really understand what you are saying but the docs state this
Traded volume (tv)
is calculated as backers stake x 2. For example, 4.1,"tv":37.64 indicates that a total backers stake of £18.82 has been matched at a price of 4.1/
ie. the layers liability isn't applicable however it is on betdaq where it is calculated differently

text:
<@U4H19D1D2> Perfect, thank you very much for sharing.

Regarding what I mentioned, it was a wrong view of the TV value, the person explained to me that I should divide the volume in the way it appears when you are going to place the bet: if you Back 666.66 at odds of 1.5, your profit will be 333.33, so for you to have this profit, someone placed 333.33 in Lay. Sum the two values, we would have 1000 transacted.

But this is not taken into account in the Traded Volume.

text: If you back 666.66 at odds of 1.5 your profit will be 333.33. If someone lays at odds of 1.5 for 666.66 their loss will be 333.33, thus it reconciles
